page.title: 06SEA LIFE IN DORNIE
page.content: The lochs have always been important to Dornie.When Mr MacRae was young there were ferries across Loch Long and Loch Duich.These cost an old penny.There used to be an anchorage for tall ships but this was destroyed when the bridge was built in 1936.The boys enjoyed fishing,as well as football,shinty and climbing the hills in Mr MacRae's youth.They did not use fancy rods but simple bamboo poles. There were plenty of fish and Mr MacRae remembers once seeing in Loch Hourn a shoal of herring which was 15m in depth.There were millions of fish. The fish were much larger than they are now and if you wanted a salmon to eat it was easy to go and lift one out of the loch.
